page.title: 05Scalebyhill Chapel
page.content: In Scalebyhill stands the oldest chapel on the Methodist Northwestern circuit.The early 19th cent. Method- ist preachers held field meetings here, on a hilltop at the farm of a Mr. Palmer. The first meetings were disrupted by organised egg- and stone- throwing. Once, a house was besieged until the preacher hiding there gave himself up. He was thrown into a dungheap and trampled. In 1828, Mr. Palmer built the small stone on the site of the meetings. It is still cared for by a descendant of the family who lives in the village.
